page.title: 08EMPLOYMENT
page.content: BRORA IS A SMALL,QUIET VILLAGE ON THE EAST COAST OF SCOTLAND.THERE IS A SMALL AMOUNT OF JOBS GOING.SOME OF THEM INCLUDED ARE : DISTILLERY , SHOPS , HOTELS , FARMING , HOMEHELPS , MILL ,RESTURANTS AND FISHING. THE DISTILLERY IS A BIG PLACE.IT PRODUCES CLYNELISH WHISKY.THE WHISKY IS SENT TO PLACES SUCH AS INVERNESS, DINGWALL AND BONAR BRIDGE.THE DISTILLERY , WHICH IS IN USE NOW, IS A RELATIVELY NEW ONE.IT IS ON THE OPPOSITE SIDE OF THE ROAD TO THE OLD ONE.THE OLD ONE IS USED AS A STOREHOUSE. SHOPS ARE A CHIEF IMPLOYMENT. A SMALL LIST OF THE MAIN SHOPS INCLUDE: MACE , CUNNINGHAMS , CO-OP , LONDON HOUSE , CHEMIST AND ARGYLL HOUSE.MACE AND THE CO-OPERATIVE ARE SMALL SUPERMARKETS, LONDON HOUSE IS A CLOTHES SHOP.
